import React, { useEffect, useState } from 'react' import Home from './Home/Home'; import CustomImage from './CustomImage'; const Books = () => { const [mybooks, setMyBooks] = useState([]); const [showIcon, setShowIcon] = useState(false) const [singleBook, setSingleBook] = useState({}) useEffect(() => { fetch("http://localhost:2000/books") .then((response) => response.json()) .then((data) => { setMyBooks(data); }) .catch((error) => console.error("Error fetching data:", error)); }, []); console.log("first", singleBook) return (
Books
"Books are gateways to knowledge, imagination, and new perspectives. A single book can inspire, change a mindset, or spark creativity, making reading a lifelong treasure."
More Books
{mybooks?.map(({ id, type, name, price }, index) => (
setSingleBook({ id, type, name, price })}>
{type} {name} ${price}
{showIcon ? (
setShowIcon(true)}>
) : (
)}
))}
) } export default Books
